documentation.text:
mapping of each transactions for each index/job.
 mainly used to keep track of where the money is. if both are at 0,
 then the funds were returned to creator after dispute.

attributes.text: @dev this function will set the treasury

@dev this function will send the funds to the payee
 @param _index is the index of the jobs
@dev this function will deposit the fees into the treasury

confirmJobCompletion(uint256,bool).details: this function will allow the creator to confirm that the job is complete and then will pay the payee

params._index: is the index of the job
params._satisfied: this will be true if he is _satisfied and then the funds will be sent to the payee and it will be false if he wants to dispute it.

createItemAndDepositFunds(address,string.details: this function will create the job and accept the deposit from the creator.

params._escrowDetails: a description of what the job is
params._payee: is the person that is going to be paid once job is _completed
params._priceInWei: the price that is going to be deposited and paid to the payee

depositFees().details: this function will deposit the fees into the treasury

jobCompletion(uint256,bool).details: this function will allow the payee to let the creator know they have completed the job.

params._completed: this will be true if he completed the task and false if he wants to dispute it

resolveDispute(uint256,uint8).details: this function will resolve any dispute that occurs. The owner of the contract will be able to talk to both parties and come up with a decision on who is correct.

params._index: this is the index of the job
params._setState: is the state that the mediator wants to put the job to

setTreasury(address).details: this function will set the treasury

transactions(uint256,address).notice: mapping of each transactions for each index/job. mainly used to keep track of where the money is. if both are at 0, then the funds were returned to creator after dispute.
